definitions: tropical lizard that changes skin color for camouflage and communication
person who changes opinions or behavior to suit different situations
examples: The chameleon blended perfectly with the branch it was resting on
We watched the chameleon catch insects with its long sticky tongue
He's a political chameleon who shifts positions based on public opinion
Don't trust her promises because she's a chameleon in negotiations

definitions: sparkling white wine produced in the Champagne region of France
pale yellowish or golden color resembling the wine
examples: They opened champagne to celebrate their wedding anniversary together
The champagne bubbles tickled her nose as she took a sip
She chose a champagne dress for the summer garden party
The walls were painted in a soft champagne shade

definitions: extensive area of level open country without hills or forests
examples: The army advanced across the champaign toward the distant mountains
Wheat fields stretched across the champaign as far as we could see

definitions: chief minister of state in certain European countries
chief executive officer of a university or college system
high-ranking official in certain Christian churches
examples: The German Chancellor addressed parliament about the economic crisis
Britain's Chancellor of the Exchequer presented the annual budget yesterday
The university chancellor presided over the graduation ceremony with dignity
She was appointed chancellor after twenty years of academic service
The diocesan chancellor advised the bishop on legal matters
The chancellor sealed the document with the church's official stamp

definitions: person who makes or sells candles and soap products
dealer in supplies and equipment for ships and boats
examples: The colonial chandler worked with tallow to create household candles
She bought scented candles from the local chandler's shop
The ship's chandler provided rope, sails, and navigation equipment
Sailors visited the chandler before embarking on long voyages

definitions: green-skinned grape variety used in white wine production
dry white wine made from chardonnay grapes
examples: The vineyard planted ten acres of chardonnay vines last spring
Chardonnay grapes thrive in cooler climate regions worldwide
She ordered a glass of oaked chardonnay with her seafood
This California chardonnay has notes of vanilla and butter

definitions: person who drives a chariot, especially in ancient warfare or racing
examples: The Roman charioteer skillfully controlled four horses during the race
Ancient charioteers were celebrated athletes in Greek and Roman society

definitions: ferryman in Greek mythology who carries souls across the river Styx
largest moon of the dwarf planet Pluto
examples: In Greek mythology, Charon required payment to ferry the dead
Artists often depict Charon as a grim figure with a boat
Charon orbits Pluto every six days in synchronous rotation
NASA's spacecraft captured detailed images of Charon's icy surface

definitions: member of 19th-century British working-class movement for political reform
financial analyst who uses charts to predict market trends
examples: The Chartists demanded universal male suffrage in Victorian Britain
Many Chartists were imprisoned for their political activism
The chartist predicted a bull market based on price patterns
Professional chartists analyze candlestick formations to time trades

definitions: vivid yellow-green color between green and yellow
French liqueur made by Carthusian monks from herbs
examples: The designer chose chartreuse accents for the modern living room
Her chartreuse scarf added a bold pop of color
The monks have kept the chartreuse recipe secret for centuries
He sipped the green chartreuse slowly after dinner

definitions: act of pursuing someone or something to catch them
groove or channel cut in metal for ornamentation or threading
tract of unenclosed land reserved for hunting
examples: The police chase lasted thirty minutes through downtown streets
The cat gave chase when the mouse ran across the floor
The jeweler cut a decorative chase into the silver bracelet
Thread the pipe through the chase in the wall
The royal chase covered thousands of acres of forest
Poaching in the lord's chase was punishable by death

definitions: hard yellow or white cheese originally from Somerset, England
village in Somerset, England where the cheese originated
examples: She grated sharp cheddar over the baked potato
This aged cheddar has developed calcium lactate crystals
We visited the caves in Cheddar where cheese was traditionally aged
The Cheddar Gorge attracts thousands of tourists yearly

definitions: deep-buttoned leather sofa with rolled arms and back
formal overcoat with concealed buttons and velvet collar
brand of cigarettes popular in mid-20th century
examples: The leather chesterfield dominated the gentleman's club lounge
They bought an antique chesterfield for their library
He wore a wool chesterfield over his business suit
The chesterfield coat never goes out of style
His grandfather smoked Chesterfield cigarettes for forty years
The old Chesterfield advertisements featured celebrity endorsements

definitions: member of certain orders of knighthood or honor
historical French cavalryman or mounted knight
examples: He was made a Chevalier of the Legion of Honor
The chevalier swore loyalty to his lord and king
Medieval chevaliers formed the backbone of French armies
The chevalier rode into battle wearing full armor

definitions: hardy breed of sheep from the Cheviot Hills
rough woolen fabric made from cheviot sheep wool
examples: Cheviot sheep are known for their hardiness in harsh climates
The farmer raised cheviots for both meat and wool
His cheviot suit was perfect for the Scottish weather
The tailor recommended cheviot fabric for the hunting jacket

definitions: red wine from the Chianti region of Tuscany, Italy
examples: We paired the chianti with pasta and tomato sauce
This chianti classico comes from the heart of Tuscany

definitions: American of Mexican origin or descent, especially one who is politically aware
examples: The Chicano movement fought for civil rights in the 1960s
She teaches Chicano studies at the state university

definitions: smallest breed of dog originating from Mexico
largest state in Mexico bordering the United States
examples: Her chihuahua fits perfectly in a small carrying bag
The chihuahua barked fiercely despite its tiny size
They crossed the border into Chihuahua from Texas
Chihuahua City is the state capital of Chihuahua

definitions: fire-breathing monster in Greek mythology with lion, goat, and serpent parts
organism containing cells from two different genetic sources
deep-sea fish related to sharks and rays
examples: The ancient vase depicted a chimaera breathing fire at warriors
In mythology, Bellerophon slayed the fearsome chimaera
Scientists created a chimaera with cells from two embryos
The medical chimaera helped researchers study organ development
The chimaera fish has a cartilaginous skeleton like sharks
Deep-sea chimaeras use electroreception to find prey

definitions: unrealistic or impossible hope, dream, or goal
organism with cells from two different genetic sources
mythological creature with parts from multiple animals
examples: His plan for world peace was dismissed as a chimera
The perfect society remains a chimera despite our efforts
Researchers created a human-pig chimera for medical research
The chimera embryo contained cells from two species
The chimera sculpture combined a lion's head with a goat's body
Ancient Greeks feared the fire-breathing chimera

definitions: protruding part of the face below the mouth
examples: She rested her chin on her hand while thinking
The boxer took a hard punch directly to the chin

definitions: 18th-century English furniture style characterized by ornate carving
male exotic dancer or stripper, from the dance troupe
examples: The antique Chippendale chair sold for thousands at auction
Their dining room features authentic Chippendale furniture
The bachelorette party hired Chippendale dancers for entertainment
He worked as a Chippendale dancer in Las Vegas

definitions: wise centaur in Greek mythology who taught heroes
minor planet orbiting between Saturn and Uranus
examples: Chiron taught medicine and warfare to Achilles and Jason
Unlike other centaurs, Chiron was known for wisdom and kindness
Astronomers classify Chiron as both a comet and asteroid
Chiron orbits the sun every fifty years

definitions: medium-sized dog breed with thick fur and blue-black tongue
informal term for food or a meal
examples: Their chow chow has a distinctive lion-like mane
The chow breed originated in ancient China
The soldiers lined up for chow at the mess hall
Let's grab some chow before the movie starts

definitions: title given to Jesus of Nazareth meaning anointed one
the promised deliverer of the Jewish nation prophesied in Hebrew Bible
examples: Christians believe Christ died for humanity's sins and rose again
The word Christ comes from the Greek translation of Messiah
Jews awaited the coming of the Christ to restore Israel
Many claimed to be the Christ during Roman occupation

definitions: worldwide body or society of Christians and Christian nations collectively
examples: Medieval Christendom was united under the authority of the Pope
The Crusades were launched to defend Christendom from Islamic expansion

definitions: person who follows the teachings of Jesus Christ
personal name commonly given in Christian cultures
examples: The early Christians faced persecution in the Roman Empire
She became a Christian after attending church with friends
His parents named him Christian after his grandfather
Christian Bale won an Oscar for his performance

definitions: process of converting individuals or societies to Christianity
examples: The Christianisation of Europe took place over many centuries
Missionaries led the Christianisation of indigenous populations worldwide

definitions: monotheistic religion based on the life and teachings of Jesus Christ
examples: Christianity spread throughout the Roman Empire in its early centuries
Christianity is the world's largest religion by number of adherents

definitions: process of converting people or cultures to Christianity
examples: The Christianization of Scandinavia occurred during the Middle Ages
Forced Christianization destroyed many indigenous religious practices

definitions: branch of Christian theology relating to the person and work of Jesus Christ
examples: Seminary students must take courses in Christology and soteriology
Different denominations have varying approaches to Christology

definitions: fairy tale character who rises from servitude to royalty
person or thing that achieves unexpected success from obscurity
examples: Cinderella's glass slipper led the prince to find her
Disney's Cinderella remains one of their most beloved films
The team's championship run was a real Cinderella story
She went from intern to CEO in a Cinderella rise

definitions: enchantress in Greek mythology who turned Odysseus's men into swine
examples: Circe used magic potions to transform sailors into animals
Odysseus resisted Circe's magic with the help of Hermes

definitions: surgical removal of the foreskin from the male penis
religious rite of passage in Judaism and Islam
examples: The doctor performed the circumcision on the newborn baby
Medical circumcision may reduce certain infection risks
Jewish boys undergo circumcision on the eighth day after birth
The circumcision ceremony included prayers and celebrations

definitions: member of a Roman Catholic monastic order founded in 1098
examples: The Cistercian monks lived according to strict rules of poverty
Cistercian abbeys were built in remote locations for contemplation

definitions: quotation from or reference to a book, paper, or author
official summons to appear in court for violation
official commendation for brave or meritorious action
examples: Include proper citations for all sources in your research paper
The article had over fifty citations to peer-reviewed journals
The officer issued a citation for speeding in a school zone
She received three parking citations in one month
The soldier received a citation for bravery under fire
The mayor presented citations to outstanding community volunteers

definitions: fine-grained natural earth material that becomes plastic when wet
crushed brick or stone surface used for tennis courts
human body as mortal substance in religious or poetic contexts
examples: The potter shaped the clay into a beautiful vase
Children love playing with modeling clay in art class
The French Open is played on red clay courts
Clay court specialists excel at sliding and long rallies
From dust and clay were humans formed according to scripture
Our mortal clay returns to earth when we die

definitions: muse of history in Greek mythology
advertising industry award for creative excellence
examples: Ancient historians invoked Clio before writing their chronicles
Clio is often depicted holding scrolls or tablets
Their campaign won three Clio awards for innovative design
The Clio Awards recognize excellence in advertising worldwide

definitions: large Scottish breed of draft horse with feathered legs
examples: The brewery uses Clydesdale horses to pull promotional wagons
Clydesdales can weigh over two thousand pounds when fully grown

definitions: queen in Greek mythology who murdered her husband Agamemnon
examples: Clytemnestra killed Agamemnon in revenge for sacrificing their daughter
In Greek tragedy, Clytemnestra represents feminine vengeance and power

definitions: South American plant whose leaves contain cocaine alkaloid
plant ingredient historically used in Coca-Cola beverage
examples: Indigenous peoples chew coca leaves for energy and altitude sickness
Coca cultivation is legal for traditional use in Bolivia
The original Coca-Cola recipe included extracts from coca leaves
Modern Coca-Cola uses decocainized coca leaf extract for flavoring

definitions: native of London's East End, traditionally born within earshot of Bow Bells
distinctive dialect or accent associated with working-class Londoners
examples: The cockney vendor sold flowers at the market
Traditional cockneys are becoming rare in modern London
His cockney accent featured dropped h's and rhyming slang
The actor perfected a cockney dialect for the role

definitions: high-quality brandy distilled from wine in the Cognac region of France
examples: He savored the aged cognac in a snifter glass
Fine cognac should be enjoyed neat at room temperature

definitions: solid carbon fuel made by heating coal in absence of air
colloquial name for Coca-Cola soft drink
slang term for cocaine drug
examples: The steel mill uses coke in blast furnaces
Coke burns hotter than regular coal in industrial processes
She ordered a coke with her burger and fries
Would you prefer coke or another soft drink?
Police arrested dealers selling coke on street corners
His coke addiction destroyed his career and family

definitions: nut from African kola tree containing caffeine
carbonated soft drink flavored with cola nut extract
examples: Traditional cola nuts are chewed for their stimulant effects
The cola nut has cultural significance in West Africa
She prefers diet cola to regular sugary versions
Major cola brands compete for global market share

definitions: scented liquid made from alcohol and fragrant oils
major city in western Germany on the Rhine River
examples: He applied cologne before going to the dinner party
This cologne has notes of cedar and bergamot
Cologne Cathedral is one of Germany's most visited landmarks
They took a river cruise from Cologne to Amsterdam

definitions: punctuation mark consisting of two dots placed vertically
part of large intestine extending from cecum to rectum
examples: Use a colon before introducing a list of items
The colon separates hours from minutes in time notation
The doctor found polyps during the colon examination
The colon absorbs water from digested food material

definitions: country or area under political control of another country
group of organisms of same species living together
community of people with shared interests living together
examples: India was a British colony until gaining independence in 1947
The thirteen colonies declared independence from British rule
The ant colony contained thousands of workers and one queen
Scientists studied the penguin colony on the Antarctic island
The artist colony attracted painters and sculptors from worldwide
They joined a retirement colony in sunny Florida

definitions: male horse under four years of age
brand of firearms, especially revolvers
examples: The spirited colt ran alongside its mother in the pasture
They're training the colt for next year's racing season
He collected vintage Colt revolvers from the Old West
The Colt .45 became known as the Peacemaker

definitions: large-scale buying and selling of goods and services between businesses
examples: International commerce drives the global economy forward continuously
The chamber of commerce supports local business development initiatives
